com.impinj.octane

Class AntennaConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.impinj.octane.AntennaConfig

  • public class AntennaConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    This class hold the antenna configuration information. AntennaConfig objects are contained within the AntennaGroupObject in the Settings class
    See Also:
    Settings.antennas

    • Constructor Summary

      AntennaConfig(short newPortNumber)
      Constructor for a new antenna configuration object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AntennaConfig

        public AntennaConfig(short newPortNumber)
        Constructor for a new antenna configuration object.
        Parameters:
        newPortNumber - Antenna port to configure. A value of 0 means configuration is applied to all antennas.

    • Method Detail

      • getRxSensitivityinDbm

        public double getRxSensitivityinDbm()
        Receive Sensitivity can be adjusted on the antenna to prevent the reader from receiving weak responses from tags. This may be used to limit the read range of the device. Sensitivity is specified in dBm (decibel milliwatts).
        Returns:
        the current value of receive sensitivity in dBm for this antenna

      • setRxSensitivityinDbm

        public void setRxSensitivityinDbm(double rxSensitivityinDbm)
        Receive Sensitivity can be adjusted on the antenna to prevent the reader from receiving weak responses from tags. This may be used to limit the read range of the device. Sensitivity is specified in dBm (decibel milliwatts).
        Parameters:
        rxSensitivityinDbm - -- sensitivity for this antenna in dBm

      • getTxPowerinDbm

        public double getTxPowerinDbm()
        Transmit power can be adjusted on the antenna to reduce the read range of the antenna. Transmit power is specified in dBm (decibel milliwatts)
        Returns:
        the current value of the transmit power in dBm for this antenna

      • setTxPowerinDbm

        public void setTxPowerinDbm(double txPowerinDbm)
        Transmit power can be adjusted on the antenna to reduce the read range of the antenna. Transmit power is specified in dBm (decibel milliwatts)
        Parameters:
        txPowerinDbm - -- power for this antenna in dBm

      • getIsMaxRxSensitivity

        public java.lang.Boolean getIsMaxRxSensitivity()
        Typically an antenna is set to maximum sensitivity. This provides the longest read range. However, maximum sensitivity can be disabled and the sensitivity can be controlled vi setRxSensitivity.
        Returns:
        true if the antenna is set to maximum sensitivity
        See Also:
        setRxSensitivityinDbm(double)

      • setIsMaxRxSensitivity

        public void setIsMaxRxSensitivity(java.lang.Boolean maxRxSensitivity)
        Typically an antenna is set to maximum sensitivity. This provides the longest read range. However, maximum sensitivity can be disabled and the sensitivity can be controlled vi setRxSensitivity.
        Parameters:
        maxRxSensitivity - -- true to enabled maximum sensitivity on this antenna. False to allow the antenna reduced sensitivity via setRxSensitivity method.
        See Also:
        setRxSensitivityinDbm(double)

      • getIsMaxTxPower

        public java.lang.Boolean getIsMaxTxPower()
        Typically an antenna is set to maximum transmit power. This provides the longest read range. However, maximum transmit power can be disabled and the power can be controlled via setTxPower.
        Returns:
        true if the antenna is set to operate at maximum power
        See Also:
        setTxPowerinDbm(double)

      • setIsMaxTxPower

        public void setIsMaxTxPower(java.lang.Boolean maxTxPower)
        Typically an antenna is set to maximum transmit power. This provides the longest read range. However, maximum transmit power can be disabled and the power can be controlled via setTxPower.
        Parameters:
        maxTxPower - -- true to set the antenna to maximum power. false to allow the power to be varied by the setTxPowerinDbm method.
        See Also:
        setTxPowerinDbm(double)

      • getPortNumber

        public short getPortNumber()
        Each antenna is identified by the port number
        Returns:
        the port number corresponding to this antenna configuration.

      • setPortNumber

        public void setPortNumber(short portNumber)
        Each antenna is identified by the port number to which this antenna configuration applies.
        Parameters:
        portNumber - the desired port number for this antenna configuration

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        An antenna can be enabled or disabled. When enabled, the reader will use this antenna when performing inventory operations.
        Returns:
        true if the antenna is enabled

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        An antenna can be enabled or disabled. When enabled, the reader will use this antenna when performing inventory operations.
        Parameters:
        enabled - -- pass true to enable the antenna, false to disable it

      • getPortName

        public java.lang.String getPortName()
        For convenience the antenna configuration hold a user defined port name. This port name is not used by the SDK library, but is provided only for application use.
        Returns:
        the current name given to this antenna port

      • setPortName

        public void setPortName(java.lang.String portName)
        For convenience the antenna configuration hold a user defined port name. This port name is not used by the SDK library, but is provided only for application use.
        Parameters:
        portName - the name to apply to this antenna port
